thread.section_title: News24, South Africa's premier news source, provides breaking news on national, world, Africa, sport, entertainment, technology & more.
thread.title: Protests - Freedom of expression

author: news24.com
title: Protests - Freedom of expression
text:
There is something that I do not understand about the protests that we have is South Africa. Where in our constitution does it say that you have the right to burn tyres; damage property; burn down vehicles, buses and robots; stone police and loot stores?
Why is it so easy for South Africans and sometimes it is not even for a just cause. Eg. Someone in community dies. (PROTEST).
Not happy with service delivery. (Protest).
Municipality changes district. (Protest).
Not happy with Wollies. (Protest).
Upset about housing issues. (Protest).
Employer fires workers for illegal strike. (Lets protest even more.)
The country spends millions and millions in damages when that finances could have gone to departments that needs to be worked on. (Health, Education and Justice systems)
We need to protest about things that matter... Abuse, Rape, Violence against women and kids, Corruption in government, Unemployment...
